intro: Olmeca, commonly known as the Mexican buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy, often toxic plants. The plant features delicate, cup-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, with five petals. Its leaves are palmately divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. Olmeca thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forested areas.
